title: Jukka Lehtovaara
text:
Jukka Lehtovaara (born 15 March 1988) is a <a href="Finland">Finnish</a> retired <a href="association%20football">football</a> goalkeeper.
Club career.
He made his debut in <a href="Veikkausliiga%20season%202006">2006</a>. During the <a href="Veikkausliiga%20season%202007">2007</a> Lehtovaara gained his place as the starting goalie for the team. After the season, he was nominated as the goalkeeper of the year and rookie of the year in Finland. He is generally considered as one of the most promising footballers in Finland. <a href="Veikkausliiga%202009">2009</a> he was nominated again as the goalkeeper of the year after a terrific season and thus has stirred up a lot of interest in bigger clubs. He continued dominating in the <a href="2010%20Veikkausliiga">2010</a> season as well, winning the goalkeeper of the year award again.
Lehtovaara has played several caps for Finland on different junior levels and he is currently a member of the <a href="Finland%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Finland national under-21 football team</a>. He has also visited the training camps of, for example, <a href="West%20Ham%20United%20FC">West Ham United FC</a>, <a href="Liverpool%20F.C.">Liverpool F.C.</a>, <a href="Chelsea%20FC">Chelsea FC</a>, <a href="Everton%20FC">Everton FC</a> and <a href="Fulham%20FC">Fulham FC</a>. On 4 November 2010 he is on a one-week trial at <a href="West%20Bromwich%20Albion%20F.C.">West Bromwich</a>.
On 8 December 2014, he signed a two-year contract with <a href="FC%20Inter%20Turku">FC Inter Turku</a>, but announced his retirement from the game two years later in October 2016 due to recurring injuries.
International career.
Lehtovaara made his debut for Finnish national squad on 21 May 2010 against <a href="Estonia%20national%20football%20team">Estonia</a>, playing the first half in a 2–0 away defeat.
